plugins.name: Layer Name Lister
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that provides a hierarchical view of selected layers and their children. This plugin makes it easy to copy layer names with their complete hierarchy or simple structure for documentation, handoff, or reference purposes.


Also pretty useful if the layers need to be fed to an LLM for cross checking against a checklist of fields that need to be included in the UI (that's why I developed this plugin)


Features

- Recursive Layer Traversal: Lists all selected layers and recursively shows their children

- Multiple Output Formats:

- Full Paths: Shows complete hierarchical paths of each layer

- Simple Names: Shows only the layer names without parent paths

- JSON Format: Structured data format including layer IDs, types, and hierarchy

- Cycle Detection: Avoids infinite loops with automatic cycle detection

- Copy to Clipboard: One-click copy of the entire layer hierarchy

- Live Updates: Automatically updates when selection changes

- Resizable Interface: Adjust the plugin window size to your needs

- Performance Optimized: Handles large layer structures efficiently with batch processing


Outputs

Full Paths (Default)

Frame 1
Frame 1 / Button
Frame 1 / Button / Label
Frame 1 / Button / Icon
Frame 1 / Content
Frame 1 / Content / Title
Frame 1 / Content / Description


Simple Names

Frame 1
Button
Label
Icon
Content
Title
Description


JSON Format

[
{
"id": "1:2",
"name": "Frame 1",
"type": "FRAME",
"path": "Frame 1",
"level": 0,
"children": [
{
"id": "1:3",
"name": "Button",
"type": "INSTANCE",
"path": "Frame 1 / Button",
"level": 1,
"children": [...]
},
...
]
}
]
plugins.tagline: A plugin that will give you a plain text list of the layers you have selected (incl. children)

plugins.name: Calculator
plugins.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma’s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

127100.name: Calculator
127100.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figma’s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
127100.release_notes:
Enhanced Number Parsing:
Improved handling of thousand separators (1,000 and 1.000)
Better detection of decimal points vs thousand separators
Support for both European (1.234,56) and American (1,234.56) number formats
Currency Support:
Added recognition of currency symbols ($, €, £, ₴, ¥, ₿)
Support for currency codes (USD, EUR, GBP, UAH, JPY, BTC, ETH, USDT)
Handles currency notation at both start and end of numbers (e.g., "$1,000" and "1,000 USD")
Error Handling:
Added informative messages when no text layers are selected
Added feedback when no valid numeric values are found
127100.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

plugins.name: Sudoku Frame
plugins.description:
Boost your design workflow with Sudoku Frame, the ultimate Figma plugin for creating customizable Sudoku tables in seconds! Perfect for designers, prototypers, and puzzle enthusiasts, this plugin lets you generate Sudoku grids with 4 difficulty levels—Easy, Medium, Hard, and Expert.


Choose between Numbers or Letters to suit your project’s style. With the Show Outlines mode, reveal answers effortlessly while keeping them hidden in the default view—ideal for testing, prototyping, or adding interactive elements to your designs.


Whether you're mocking up educational tools, game interfaces, or creative layouts, Sudoku Frame streamlines the process with precision and flexibility. Download now and start designing smarter!

accepted.name: Andy Legenki
accepted.description: Hey, I’m Andy—a designer and content creator specializing in design, freelancing, and self-development. Here, I share my creative work, insights, and the skills

plugins.tagline: Generate Custom Sudoku Tables with Ease

Whether you're mocking up educational tools, game interfaces, or creative layouts, Sudoku Frame streamlines the process with precision and flexibility. Download now and start designing smarter!

plugins.name: Copy Paste Overrides
plugins.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!

accepted.name: Fabian Schneider
accepted.description:
UX/UI Designer from 🇦🇹 formerly in 🇩🇪
Other guilty pleasures include Motion Graphics + 3D, Branding and Illustration.

plugins.tagline: Copy the overrides of an instance and paste them onto another instance to replicate it

119945.name: Copy Paste Overrides
119945.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!
119945.release_notes:
You can copy and paste overrides for component properties from one instance onto another.

Known limitations:
- nested instances don't fully work
- only overrides for specified properties are copied (for example a text that is changed without it being a property won't be copied)
119945.tagline: Copy the overrides of an instance and paste them onto another instance to replicate it

Just input the details, and the plugin will automatically create and arrange the artboards on your canvas. Save time and stay organized with this essential design tool.

plugins.name: Figma Frame History
plugins.description:
This tool enables version-controlled frame history management directly on the page. It offers four key commands:


• Major Version: Select a BASE NODE on the page and execute this command. A NEW NODE will be created right after the BASE NODE, with a version control suffix in its name (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v2.0).


• Minor Version: Similar to the **Major Version** command, but only the minor version number is incremented by 1 (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v1.1).


• Unlock History: This command unlocks all previously locked frames in the history, restoring them to their default style.


• Lock History: This command locks all history frames again, making them transparent.


If the BASE NODE name does not include a version control suffix _${majorVersion}.${minorVersion}, the NEW NODE name will default to ${baseNodeName}_v1.0 when either the Major Version or Minor Version command is executed.

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: A frame history management tool for creating and organizing frame versions directly on the page

• Minor Version: Similar to the **Major Version** command, but only the minor version number is incremented by 1 (e.g., Frame_1.0 → Frame_v1.1).


• Unlock History: This command unlocks all previously locked frames in the history, restoring them to their default style.


• Lock History: This command locks all history frames again, making them transparent.


If the BASE NODE name does not include a version control suffix _${majorVersion}.${minorVersion}, the NEW NODE name will default to ${baseNodeName}_v1.0 when either the Major Version or Minor Version command is executed.
139370.release_notes:
- refactor: remove the timestamp in the node name
- feat: new ui view to show the timestamps of the frame version history
- feat: ui view resize feature
- feat: Section version control

139370.tagline: A frame history management tool for creating and organizing frame versions directly on the page

plugins.description:
Lindi revolutionizes the way UI/UX designs are created by leveraging advanced artificial intelligence to automate and enhance the design process. Users can rapidly prototype, iterate, and finalize visually appealing and user-friendly UI/UX designs.


This plugin is solely made for Tawakkalna Services allowing entities to build flows and designs with Tawakkalna's Design System rules.


The Plugin generates and transfers ready made designs from Lindi - The AI Designer to Figma allowing designers to view, create, and modify the contents of the files in Figma.

plugins.name: tailwindcss inspector
plugins.description:
This plugin generates class names based on your tailwind.config.js file. For example:


If you've defined "brand": "var(--emphasis-brand)" in theme.extend.colors, when a button's background color uses the --emphasis-brand variable, the plugin will automatically generate the bg-brand class for you.
plugins.tagline: Generate tailwindcss code based on your config file

plugins.name: Color Snap
plugins.description:
Color Snap instantly extracts a 5-color palette (plus a smooth 45° gradient) from any selected image, no extra clicks or external tools required. Simply select an image in your Figma file, run Color Snap, and watch it generate:

  1. Five 48×48 solid swatches of your image’s dominant colors
  2. One 48×48 gradient swatch blending those colors at a 45° angle
  3. Neatly arranged in a “Snapped colors” frame, ready for reuse


Why you’ll love it

  1. Speed up mood-boarding: Pull palettes directly from visuals
  2. Stay on-brand: Quickly generate gradients that perfectly match your assets


Vibe coded with ❤❤️️ using o4-mini high
plugins.tagline: Instantly extract color palette from any selected image

plugins.name: Frontify Template Checker
plugins.description:
This plugin checks your Figma designs and highlights potential issues before uploading them as templates into Frontify. It’s designed to improve your template creation and management experience — making the integration between Figma and Frontify more seamless.


Issues

We’re continuously refining and expanding the list of checks. This initial release focuses on the most common issues, with more to come. As we improve template import capabilities, some checks may also be retired.


  1. Auto-layout frames
  2. Layers with multiple fills
  3. Frames with image fills
  4. Text case transformations
  5. Image filters
  6. Mixed text styles within a single text element
  7. Unsupported elements
  8. Empty pages
  9. Slice layers
  10. Flip transformations
  11. OpenType features
  12. Hanging punctuation


Support

If you come across issues not currently covered by the plugin, please contact your Customer Success Manager or email us at support@frontify.com.

accepted.name: Frontify
accepted.description: With our best-in-class brand management platform, Frontify is on a mission to create a home where all brands can thrive.

plugins.tagline: A simple tool to help you prepare your template for Frontify, right within Figma.

plugins.name: Figma to Cape Template Designer
plugins.description:
Seamlessly Copy Figma Designs to Template Designer


🚀 Copy layers and frames from Figma directly into Template Designer.

🎨 Save time by avoiding manual recreation—copy, paste, and edit instantly.

⚡ Keep your workflow fast and efficient, focusing on design instead of tedious adjustments.

🔄 Easily update and edit imported layers, plus create unlimited formats.


Perfect for designers who want to work smarter. ✨


How to Use the Plugin

1 Select a frame or layer in Figma and click “Copy” in the plugin.

2 Open Template Designer and paste with ⌘V (or Ctrl + V on Windows).

3 Edit, update, and create multiple formats effortlessly!


Features

✅ Save Time & Work Efficiently

Skip the hassle of recreating designs—copy from Figma and start building immediately.

✅ Editable Layers

Make changes to text, images, and more within Template Designer.

✅ Unlimited Formats

Create multiple formats from a single design.

⚠️ Keep in Mind

Some advanced Figma styling elements may not be fully supported.


What is Template Designer?

Template Designer is part of Campaign Designer from Cape, a powerful tool for creating templates that generate multiple creatives. Designers can set up dynamic layers, allowing campaign managers to edit text, images and many more elements easily—making creative production faster and more scalable.


FAQ

What can I do with the plugin?

Quickly transfer your Figma designs into Template Designer without losing time on manual recreation.


Can I edit designs after pasting them?

Yes! You can edit imported layers, adjust elements, and create different formats.


Which elements are supported?

Most Figma layers, including text, shapes, and images. Some advanced styling may not be fully compatible.


What if I encounter an issue?

Let us know at Cape Support—we’re happy to help! ⚡️


This plugin helps designers work faster, update designs easily, and create scalable templates. Try it now and boost your workflow! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma Designs into Template Designer templates

Can I edit designs after pasting them?

Yes! You can edit imported layers, adjust elements, and create different formats.


Which elements are supported?

Most Figma layers, including text, shapes, and images. Some advanced styling may not be fully compatible.


What if I encounter an issue?

Let us know at Cape Support—we’re happy to help! ⚡️


This plugin helps designers work faster, update designs easily, and create scalable templates. Try it now and boost your workflow! 🚀
128073.release_notes: We’ve fixed some issues and made performance improvements to keep things running smoothly. Thanks for using our plugin!
128073.tagline: Transform Figma Designs into Template Designer templates

Whether you’re prototyping or finalising your project, Wallet Writer is the perfect tool to embed authentic Web3 functionality into your creative process.

plugins.name: Icon Resizer
plugins.description:
The Icon Resizer Plugin is a powerful tool designed for designers who need to resize and create multiple versions of icons quickly and efficiently. Whether you’re working on UI/UX design, branding, or graphic design, the plugin helps streamline the process of resizing icons into various sizes while maintaining design integrity.

The plugin allows users to duplicate and resize selected icons to predefined sizes (e.g., 16px, 24px, 32px, 40px, 48px) with just a few clicks. You can choose a single size or add up to five different sizes in one go.
plugins.tagline: Resize, Reimagine, and Revitalize Your Icons in a Snap!

118276.name: Icon Resizer
118276.description:
The Icon Resizer Plugin is a powerful tool designed for designers who need to resize and create multiple versions of icons quickly and efficiently. Whether you’re working on UI/UX design, branding, or graphic design, the plugin helps streamline the process of resizing icons into various sizes while maintaining design integrity.

The plugin allows users to duplicate and resize selected icons to predefined sizes (e.g., 16px, 24px, 32px, 40px, 48px) with just a few clicks. You can choose a single size or add up to five different sizes in one go.
118276.tagline: Resize, Reimagine, and Revitalize Your Icons in a Snap!

plugins.name: Banner Framer
plugins.description:
EN description below


バナーサイズの整理をもっと簡単に!!


バナー作成する際、Figmaでのフレームサイズを管理する面倒なストレスを解消します！！Banner Framerを使えば、サイズを忘れたり、フレームの名前を何度も変更する必要がなくなります〜！


Banner Framerの特徴：

•幅と高さを入力するだけでフレームを簡単に生成。

•サイズ情報が含まれた名前を自動で付けて整理をサポート。

•作業効率を上げ、手作業によるミスを軽減。


近日公開：

•サイズプリセットの保存: チームでよく使うバナーサイズを保存して簡単に再利用。

•ワンクリック生成: 保存したサイズをチェックボックスで選択し、瞬時にフレームを生成！

---------------------

Making banner size organization much easier.


Designing banners often requires juggling multiple frame sizes—a task that’s not only repetitive but prone to errors. With Banner Framer, you’ll never forget a size or have to rename frames over and over again.


What Banner Framer does:

•Generate frames effortlessly by entering width and height.

•Automatically name frames with their dimensions for better organization.

•Streamline your workflow and reduce manual errors.


Coming soon:

•Reusable size presets: Save your team’s go-to banner sizes for easy access.

•One-click creation: Select saved sizes with a checkbox and generate frames instantly!
plugins.tagline: Batch-create and customize frames with ease!

plugins.name: Avctoris Copyright
plugins.description:
The Avctoris Copyright plugin for Figma is a comprehensive tool designed to help creators protect and manage their intellectual property rights effortlessly. With this plugin, users can seamlessly generate a PDF certificate of their design work directly from their Figma workspace, ensuring that their creations are legally safeguarded.


Key Features:


Automated PDF Generation: Export your design assets into a PDF format for easy documentation and protection.

Intellectual Property Management: Record detailed information about the authors and holders of rights for each creation.

Secure Registration: Easily submit your work for copyright registration and receive a certificate, ensuring your designs are legally protected.

User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive UI integrated into Figma, allowing for a smooth and seamless experience.

Real-Time Collaboration: Continue collaborating on designs while managing copyrights without leaving Figma.
plugins.tagline: Where Ideas Come to Life

97497.name: Avctoris Copyright
97497.description:
The Avctoris Copyright plugin for Figma is a comprehensive tool designed to help creators protect and manage their intellectual property rights effortlessly. With this plugin, users can seamlessly generate a PDF certificate of their design work directly from their Figma workspace, ensuring that their creations are legally safeguarded.

Automated PDF Generation: Export your design assets into a PDF format for easy documentation and protection.

Intellectual Property Management: Record detailed information about the authors and holders of rights for each creation.

Secure Registration: Easily submit your work for copyright registration and receive a certificate, ensuring your designs are legally protected.

User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive UI integrated into Figma, allowing for a smooth and seamless experience.

Real-Time Collaboration: Continue collaborating on designs while managing copyrights without leaving Figma.

plugins.name: VariableMaster - Swap Variables
plugins.description:
VariableMaster - Master all your variable workflows


Variable Master is your complete variable workflow solution for Figma. Switch variables between any libraries - local to published, published to local, or between different files. Whether you're swapping collections within the same file or moving components from one library to another, Variable Master makes it simple and fast.


Features :


- Swap variables between local and published libraries

- Switch collections between local variables

- Switch component variables from library A to library B easily

- Work with current selection, page, or entire file

- See what will change before you apply it

- Handle thousands of variables at once

- Pick which collections to swap or exclude specific variables


How to use :


1. Choose what to update (selection, page, or file) and pick your libraries from the drop down.

2. Select which collections to swap and see the preview.

3. Uncheck variables you don't want to change, then click on swap variables.


Ps : plugin picks libraries only if they are added in the File. You can add them to you file via Asset panel.


RoadMap :


- Find all variables used in your designs

- Export and import variable collections

- Check for design elements that need variables​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​


This Plugin is completely free to use, No charges for swapping variables.
plugins.tagline: Master all your variable workflows

138841.name: VariableMaster - Swap Variables
138841.description:
VariableMaster - Master all your variable workflows


Variable Master is your complete variable workflow solution for Figma. Switch variables between any libraries - local to published, published to local, or between different files. Whether you're swapping collections within the same file or moving components from one library to another, Variable Master makes it simple and fast.


Features :


- Swap variables between local and published libraries

- Switch collections between local variables

- Switch component variables from library A to library B easily

- Work with current selection, page, or entire file

- See what will change before you apply it

- Handle thousands of variables at once

- Pick which collections to swap or exclude specific variables


How to use :


1. Choose what to update (selection, page, or file) and pick your libraries from the drop down.

2. Select which collections to swap and see the preview.

3. Uncheck variables you don't want to change, then click on swap variables.


Ps : plugin picks libraries only if they are added in the File. You can add them to you file via Asset panel.


RoadMap :


- Find all variables used in your designs

- Export and import variable collections

- Check for design elements that need variables​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​


This Plugin is completely free to use, No charges for swapping variables.

plugins.name: Import CSS shadows, create Figma styles
plugins.description:
I recently needed to create a Figma file from an existing website, and manually setting up effects took too long, so I created this plugin.


You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

accepted.name: Luis Ouriach
accepted.description:
Design & community @figmadesign. I write a newsletter, manage and host @8pxmag. 

Hot sauce on everything.

plugins.tagline: Copy, paste, generate

You can paste a CSS box-shadow, preview it, then create a style from all the shadow values.


You can also create matching variables. There is a small caveat: the Figma plugin API does not allow you to connect the style with the variable from within the plugin itself, meaning the style is disconnected from the variable. It still saves a tonne of time though!

plugins.name: Import large image(s)
plugins.description:
When posting full page screenshots into FigJam, the images would be blurry and unreadable because Figma automatically reduces image sizes when the height or width is over 4096px. Not anymore!


As a workaround, this plugin

  1. slices the original image into multiple images
  2. groups the sliced images together to create one cohesive image


What makes this plugin different from the others?

  1. The ability to import multiple images at once


If you like it, buy me a beer 🍻
plugins.tagline: Import large image(s) into Figma and Figjam, maintaining resolution and size.

plugins.name: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG
plugins.description:
في تجربة المستخدم، وضوح النصوص على الخلفيات يلعب دورًا أساسيًا في ضمان قراءة مريحة وسهلة للجميع، بما في ذلك الأشخاص ذوي الإعاقة البصرية. وهنا يأتي دور معايير WCAG التي تحدد نسبة التباين المثلى بين النص والخلفية.


💡 كيف يعمل البلغين؟

📌 حدد النص والخلفية داخل Figma، ثم اضغط على “تحليل التباين”. سيقوم البلغين بحساب نسبة التباين وإظهار تنبيه فوري يخبرك إن كان التباين متوافقًا أو غير متوافق وفقًا لمعايير WCAG.


✅ لماذا هذا مهم؟

✔️ يضمن وضوح النصوص وتحسين تجربة القراءة.

✔️ يساعد المصممين في تحقيق معايير إمكانية الوصول (Accessibility).

✔️ يختصر الوقت في اختبار الألوان داخل التصميم.
plugins.tagline: WCAG Contrast Checker|🔎 تحليل التباين وفقًا لـ WCAG

plugins.name: Simple Organizer
plugins.description:
Tired of messy Figma files?

Simple Organizer helps you create a clean and structured workspace instantly with a predefined folder system. Just run the plugin, and your project will be organized in seconds!


How It Works:

  1. Run the Simple Organizer plugin
  2. Instantly generate a structured file system
  3. Focus on designing—without the clutter


Pre-built Folder Structure:

✅ Cover – Keep your project visually organized

✅ About – Store key project info

✅ Research – Benchmarking, presentations, and data

✅ Wireframes – Name and version your iterations

✅ Design – Final designs in one place

✅ Writing – Dedicated space for content

✅ Accessibility – Specs for an inclusive experience

✅ Components – Local and system components

plugins.name: Variable JSON
plugins.description:
"Variable JSON – Seamlessly Export Figma Variables to JSON"


Quickly convert your Figma variables into clean JSON with Variable JSON. Select your Collection, Group, and Mode, generate the JSON, and copy it instantly—perfect for streamlining design-to-development workflows.


How to Use:

  1. Open Variable JSON: In Figma, go to Plugins > Variable JSON.
  2. Select Variables: Choose the Collection, Group, and Mode (e.g., Light, Dark, or Custom).
  3. Generate JSON: Click "GEN JSON" to create the JSON output based on your selection.
  4. Copy JSON: Click copy button and use it in your projects.


Effortless variable exporting starts here! 🚀

accepted.name: Innovasive Design
accepted.description: We integrate strategy, technology, and creativity to deliver a better solutions to our clients.

accepted.name: poioneer

plugins.tagline: Easily convert Figma variables to JSON—select, generate, and copy!

120354.name: Variable JSON
120354.description:
"Variable JSON – Seamlessly Export Figma Variables to JSON"


Quickly convert your Figma variables into clean JSON with Variable JSON. Select your Collection, Group, and Mode, generate the JSON, and copy it instantly—perfect for streamlining design-to-development workflows.


How to Use:

  1. Open Variable JSON: In Figma, go to Plugins > Variable JSON.
  2. Select Variables: Choose the Collection, Group, and Mode (e.g., Light, Dark, or Custom).
  3. Generate JSON: Click "GEN JSON" to create the JSON output based on your selection.
  4. Copy JSON: Click copy button and use it in your projects.


Effortless variable exporting starts here! 🚀
120354.tagline: Easily convert Figma variables to JSON—select, generate, and copy!

plugins.name: JumpMark (Jump Between Marked Figma Components Instantly)
plugins.description:
JumpMark transforms the way you navigate through complex Figma files. This powerful plugin lets you create smart bookmarks for your most-used components, layers, and sections, enabling instant navigation with smooth animations.


🎥 Watch Tutorial | 📱 Follow Us


Key Features:

  1. Smart Bookmark Groups: Organize your bookmarks into custom groups for different project sections, components, or workflows
  2. One-Click Navigation: Jump between bookmarked locations instantly with beautiful smooth animations
  3. Visual Labeling: Color-code your bookmarks and groups for quick visual recognition
  4. Notes & Documentation: Add helpful notes to bookmarks for team collaboration
  5. Drag & Drop Organization: Easily reorder bookmarks within groups
  6. Search Functionality: Quickly find any bookmark or group using the search feature
  7. Custom Animation Settings: Adjust transition speed and style for comfortable navigation


Perfect For:

  1. UX/UI designers working with large design systems
  2. Design teams collaborating on complex projects
  3. Product designers managing multiple component states
  4. Anyone working with extensive Figma files


How It Works:

  1. Select any elements you want to bookmark
  2. Create a group to organize related bookmarks
  3. Add bookmarks with optional notes and color labels
  4. Navigate instantly between locations with a single click


Free Trial Available:

Try all premium features free for 3 hours. Experience smoother Figma navigation and boost your workflow efficiency.

Transform your Figma navigation experience with JumpMark - the smart bookmarking solution for professional designers.


🎯 Stay Updated

  1. Get early access to new features
  2. Join our newsletter for design tips & updates
  3. Be part of our growing design community


✨ Need Help?

Email support

plugins.name: Sri lankan Name Generator
plugins.description: This plugin allows users to generate unique Sri Lankan names based on gender and ethnicity. It's ideal for creating culturally relevant and diverse placeholder names for mockups, wireframes, or design projects. Users can select from Sinhala, Tamil, Muslim, or Burgher names for both genders, ensuring inclusivity and variety in your designs. Easily apply names to text layers with just a few clicks!
plugins.tagline: Generate authentic Sri Lankan names by gender and ethnicity for your designs and projects.

120719.name: Sri lankan Name Generator
120719.description: This plugin allows users to generate unique Sri Lankan names based on gender and ethnicity. 🎨 New Modern UI: Updated the plugin interface with a sleek dark theme and improved layout.

🔄 Fixed Scrolling Issues: The plugin height is now fixed with no unwanted scrolling.

plugins.name: Find Word Duplicates Ninja
plugins.description:
Find Word Duplicate Ninja is your reliable assistant for quickly spotting and managing duplicate words within your designs.


Key Features:


Duplicate Word Detection:

Instantly find duplicate words across all text layers.


Automatic Highlighting:

Automatically highlights all occurrences of duplicate words for easy identification.


Customizable Settings:

Adjust minimum word length to match your specific project needs.


Seamless Navigation:

Click a duplicate word tag to navigate directly to all its occurrences within your design.


Intuitive User Interface:

Stylish, user-friendly interface with well-designed tags for optimal usability.


Performance Optimized:

Efficiently handles large files without slowing down Figma's performance.


Why Choose Find Word Duplicate Ninja?


Boost Productivity:

Quickly catch duplicate words, save time, and streamline your workflow.


Improve Consistency:

Ensure consistent text throughout your project without any overlooked duplications.


Easy to Use:

Intuitive and straightforward interface suitable for designers of all levels.
